intro: Modiola lateritia, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to rocky and arid environments in southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, bright green leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing on limestone or sandstone substrates. Modiola lateritia is a hardy perennial that is well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
